results.title: Australian Aborigines: everything from nature
results.creator_credit: A.P. Elkin and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Modern social studies”.
Our reliance on manufactured goods is contrasted with First Nations peoples’ abilities to use natural materials around them, which gives rise to a marked respect for their adaptability and sensitivity to the environment. Taken during an expedition by Sydney University to Arnhem Land in 1952.

results.title: My life
results.creator_credit: Bruce Joel Rubin, Hunt Lowry, Jerry Zucker and Capella International
results.brief_description: Bob Jones (Michael Keaton) is an ordinary man dying of cancer. As a legacy to his unborn child, he attempts to make a video of his life as he perceives it. It is only when he is confronted with the artifice of his own existence that he becomes determined to come to grips not only with the past, but with the disease. Embarking on a new lifestyle and rigid self-examination, and aided by Mr Ho, a spiritual healer, Bob undertakes a voyage of self-discovery. Nicole Kidman stars as Gail Jones, and Dr. Haing S. Ngor as Mr. Ho. Unashamedly a tear-jerker, “My life” is a compelling and sentimental drama, which emphasises the dignity of the dying and the need to embrace life. Truly vomitous.

results.title: Oz shorts. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Catherine Birmingham, Robert Herbert, Roland Gallois, Bernard Purcell, Jo Bell, Sophie Jackson, AFTRS, Arcadia Pictures, Australian Film Commission, NRG Films Australia and Puss Puss Productions,
results.brief_description: A wonderful compilation of Australian short films from the early 1990’s. The films are: “He and She” (Dir: R. Herbert) - a bickering couple get picked up by the police; “Drive” (C. Birmingham) - a mother and son take to the road after killing the “old man”; “Lullabies” (R. Gallois) - a gut-wrenching experimental film on the trauma of a dissolving relationship; “Just Desserts” (M. Pellizzari) - a delicious comedy about an Italo-Australian girl’s sexual awakening and her love for her mama’s cooking; “Excursion to the Bridge of Friendship” (C. Andreef) - a sophisticated Sydney woman decides to invite her folk-singing Bulgarian cousin to Australia. A very funny “silent” film about culture clash.

results.title: Rolf Harris' water safety
results.creator_credit: Jessica Skippon and Rolf Harris Video Productions
results.brief_description: A water safety program featuring Rolf Harris and four children, aimed at children up to about twelve years of age. The tape is divided into three sections. 1. Spot the danger (15 mins.) 2. Boating and falling into cold water (17 mins.) 3. Reach throw wade row and rescue breathing (24 mins.)

results.title: Women in the surf (Captioned)
results.brief_description: The first non-fiction feature about Australia’s women of the surf tells the history of women’s surfing in Australia from 1915. It moves through the big board era to the present day, with women coming into a surfing entity in their own right. The video shows the women surf riders surfing their own calendar and tells of their hopes, fears and pleasures as they ride the waves.

results.title: The Teacher and the Computer
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Computers”.
Teacher, Anne McDougall, talks about the introduction of computers into education and the relationship of the teacher and the computer, a paper presented to the Junior World Computer Congress, Melbourne, October 16-18, 1980.

results.title: That Hamilton woman
results.creator_credit: Alexander Korda and Alexander Korda Films
results.brief_description: That Hamilton woman opens in France, where a destitute and alcoholic woman is arrested for stealing. The woman in question is Lady Emma Hamilton (Vivien Leigh), a once famed beauty. In jail, Emma tells her story to a cellmate, casting back to a time when she was young and lovely. An English woman born to a low class, with a past riddled with infamy, Emma had managed to rise above her station. In Naples Emma is a guest of Sir William Hamilton, a British ambassador, who offers her a financially secure but loveless marriage, to which she agrees. Emma is received at court and revels in the social status of being Lady Hamilton. One day her world is upended with the arrival of Lord Nelson (Laurence Olivier), a British naval hero. Over the course of several years, Emma and Nelson are shown to have a growing affection for one another which blossoms into love. Both are in loveless marriages but divorce is impossible and society views their union with scorn. Leigh excels as Hamilton, a brave woman, beaten by societal mores of the day. The film caused a scandal in America for its depiction of adultery, and dialogue was added to portray the lovers as suffering for their indiscretions.

results.title: Zoo babies
results.brief_description: Join Channel TEN’s Lynday Davies as she follows the lives of baby animals at Sydney’s Taronga and Western Plains Zoos. The zoo witnesses the birth of many babies throughout the year, with thousands of new additions to the zoo ‘family’. You’ll see the birth of a baby gorilla and giraffe, as well as an assortment of all creatures great and small who are cared for by zoo staff.
